revision.comment: /* See also */ this link redirects back to this article
revision.text:
{{for|the periodical|Naval History (magazine)}} {{see also|Maritime history|Military history}} [[Image:Battle of Salamis, 480 BC.gif|thumb|250px| The epic [[Battle of Salamis]] between Greek and Persian naval forces.]] '''Naval history''' is the area of [[military history]] concerning [[naval warfare|war at sea]] and the subject is also a sub-discipline of the broad field of [[maritime history]].
Traditionally, the focus has been on direct combat between ships at sea, rather than the use of ships to transport armies or military supplies, although frequently [[naval strategy]] hinges on the need to protect transport shipping. Recent writing in naval history has expanded the scope of the subject to include the full range of issues associated with [[navies]], including matters of technology, finance, bureaucracy, social history, shipbuilding, supply, and logistics.
==See also== * [[List of naval battles]] * [[History of ship transport]] * [[:Category:Naval historians]], list of naval historians
==External links== * [http://www.history.navy.mil/index.html Naval History & Heritage Command] * [http://www.navyhistory.org Naval Historical Foundation] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/branches/org8-1.htm National Museum of the U.S. Navy] * [http://www.hrnm.navy.mil/ Hampton Roads Naval Museum] * [http://www.mer.paris-sorbonne.fr/ Naval History Research Center - Sorbonne University (France, Paris)] {{fr}} * [http://www.nsgreatlakes.navy.mil/museum Great Lakes Naval Museum] * [http://www.navalaviationmuseum.org/ National Naval Aviation Museum] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/museums/china_lake/china_lake.htm Naval Museum of Armament and Technology] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/museums/keyport/index1.htm Naval Undersea Museum] * [http://www.nwc.navy.mil/newportlinks/museum/museum.aspx Naval War College Museum] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/museums/psnm/psnm.htm Puget Sound Navy Museum] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/museums/paxmuseum/index.htm Patuxent River Naval Air Museum] * [http://www.seabeehf.org/museum/index.htm U.S. Navy Seabee Museum] * [http://www.ussnautilus.org/ Submarine Force Library & Museum] * [http://www.nadn.navy.mil/Museum/ U.S. Naval Academy Museum] * [https://www.netc.navy.mil/centers/css/nscs/default.cfm?fa=services.getServices&ACTYid=6 U.S. Navy Supply Corps Museum] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/branches/nhcorg6.htm Navy Art Collection] * [http://www.history.navy.mil/ussconstitution/index.html USS Constitution "Old Ironsides"] * [http://www.royal-navy.org/ Royal Navy History], extensive source of Royal Naval History. * [http://www.ijnhonline.org/ International Journal of Naval History], A Global Forum for Naval Historical Scholarship, an e-journal. * [http://www.naval-history.net/ Naval-History.Net], Naval History of the 20th Century, World Wars 1, 2, post-war and Falklands War - navies, ships, ship losses, casualties. * [http://www.denizmuzeleri.tsk.tr/en/idmk/ Ottoman Naval History], extensive source of Turkish Naval History.
